CatDescriptText: Virginia Thompson, 2806 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 12, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should well-defined courses in sex education be taught in public school system? If so, at what grade should the teaching of these courses begin?" answer reads: "I think so.  It should be taught in junior high school, about the eighth grade."
TitMainTitle: Virginia Thompson wearing dark button down collared shirt with short sleeves, standing in front of light colored stone flecked wall, store window with display for shoes on left and store window of Thrift Drugs with display of salt and pepper shakers on right
